text: Psalm 102
A Plea for Personal and National Help
A prayer of \add one\add* afflicted, when he grows faint
and pours out his lament before Yahweh.\f + \fr Ps 102 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
O Yahweh, hear my prayer,
and let my cry for help come to you.
Do not hide your face from me
in \add the\add* day \add of\add* my trouble.
Incline your ear to me.
In the day I call, answer me quickly,
for my days vanish in smoke,
and my bones are charred like a hearth.
My heart is struck like grass and withers.
Indeed, I forget to eat\f + \fr 102:4 \ft A rare homonym might yield “I am too wilted to eat” \f* my bread.
Because of the sound of my groaning
my bones\f + \fr 102:5 \ft Hebrew “bone” \f* cling to my skin.\f + \fr 102:5 \ft Hebrew “flesh” \f*
I am like an owl\f + \fr 102:6 \ft The identity of the birds in this verse is uncertain \f* of \add the\add* wilderness;
I am like a little owl of \add the\add* ruins.
I lie awake and I am
like a lone bird on a roof.
All the day my enemies reproach me;
those who mock me swear \add oaths\add* against me.
Indeed, I eat ashes like bread
and mix my drink with tears\f + \fr 102:9 \ft Hebrew “weeping” \f*
because of your indignation and anger,
for you have picked me up and thrown me away.
My days \add are\add* like a lengthened shadow,
and I wither like grass.
But you, O Yahweh, abide\f + \fr 102:12 \ft Or “sit enthroned” \f* forever,
and your remembrance\f + \fr 102:12 \ft Or “name” \f* ⸤from generation to generation⸥.\f + \fr 102:12 \ft Literally “to a generation and a generation” \f*
You rise up and take pity on Zion,
because \add it is\add* time to favor it,
for \add the\add* appointed time has come.
Your servants take pleasure in her stones,
and show favor to its dust.
Then \add the\add* nations will fear the name of Yahweh,
and all the kings of the earth your glory.
For Yahweh will rebuild Zion;
he will appear in his glory.
He will turn his attention to the prayer of the destitute
and will not despise their prayer.
Let this be written for \add the\add* next generation,
so that a people \add yet\add* to be created may praise Yah,\f + \fr 102:18 \ft A shortened form of “Yahweh” \f*
that he looked down from his holy height.
Yahweh looked from heaven over \add the\add* earth
to hear \add the\add* groaning of \add the\add* prisoner,
to liberate ⸤those destined to die⸥,\f + \fr 102:20 \ft Hebrew “\fq the \ft sons of death” \f*
so that \add they\f + \fr 102:21 \ft That is, the generation that reads what is written \f* may\add* make known in Zion the name of Yahweh,
and his praise in Jerusalem,
when the peoples assemble,
together with\f + \fr 102:22 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* kingdoms, to serve Yahweh.
He has broken my strength along the way;
he has cut short my days.
I say, “My God, do not carry me off
from my life in the middle of my days.”
Your years \add continue\add* throughout all generations.
Long ago you laid the foundation of the earth,
and \add the\add* heavens \add are\add* the work of your hands.
They will perish, but you will endure.
And like a garment they will all wear out,
you will replace them like clothing, and they will be set aside.
But you \add are\add* the same,
and your years do not end.
The children of your servants will continue,
and their ⸤descendants⸥\f + \fr 102:28 \ft Literally “seed” \f* will be established before you.
